item.title: Business Development Lead - Capital Markets
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for a critical problem solver who’s eager to help our machine learning research team deliver competitive products for RBC Capital Markets. As a member of our Business Engagement and Strategy team, you’ll be responsible for identifying exciting artificial intelligence research opportunities that will create outsized value for one of the bank’s lines of business. You’ll engage with our partners in the bank to develop strategic business plans to apply AI technologies to real-world problems, and you’ll collaborate with our product team to align business and technical stakeholders.

 

Our ideal candidate has an extensive working knowledge of capital markets and/or machine learning applications in finance, strong executive communication skills, and 2-5 years experience working in a financial institution. At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, as well as front office teams in Capital Markets. Our mission is to think big and go beyond what’s possible today to deliver competitive AI products. This is a rare opportunity to build the skills required to make machine learning work in the enterprise. You can find out more about our research areas at www.borealisai.com.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Becoming the Borealis AI expert on one or more RBC business lines;
  • Building relationships with RBC executives, subject matter experts, and technical teams;
  • Representing the business vision in the group’s product engagements and educating researchers on business needs;
  • Understanding Borealis AI research areas and creatively mapping technologies onto business problems;
  • Building and communicating strategic business plans, and collaborating with the Borealis AI research and product teams to ensure alignment, feasibility, and success; and
  • Defining and documenting business requirements and collaborating with the product and research teams to establish product scopes, test technical feasibility, and resolve any business issues that arise during product development.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have: 

  • Have front office experience in Capital Markets, Portfolio Management or a related field
  • Have working knowledge of data analytics and machine learning or a willingness to learn;
  • Have experience aligning new technologies to existing ones in large enterprises’ processes;
  • Have experience working in financial institutions;
  • Have experience developing relationships with senior and junior stakeholders at large enterprises;
  • Have experience developing business cases and other communications on technology projects;
  • Are a creative thinker who can develop long-term strategies as well as a stickler for detail on short-term commitments and deliverables;
  • Are excited to work with a machine learning research team on solving problems that cannot be solved with existing technology.

What’s in it for you? 

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

 About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment 

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an enthusiastic data engineer who’s excited by the opportunity of designing distributed systems to support applications at the forefront of machine learning technology. As a Data Engineer, you’ll be responsible for owning and delivering systems to efficiently acquire, prepare, and process data for state-of-the-art AI solutions that we build at Borealis AI.

 

Engineering plays a vital role at Borealis AI, turning our machine learning models into products that generate exponential business value. We understand the financial system we operate in, and we have the resources, knowledge and tools to improve it. Our team of 40+ engineers work with leading Machine Learning researchers to accelerate, build and deploy products that will enhance risk applications, reduce fraud, help millions of people manage cash flow, access credit and plan for their financial futures. In the finance sector, millions of people are counting on us to get it right.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Design and build data pipelines for Borealis AI projects;
  • Build efficient data systems and abstractions for Borealis AI projects;
  • Collaborating with research, engineering and business teams to model and deliver on their data needs.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent. A master’s or PhD in an AI sub-field is an asset;
  • Strong enterprise experience in designing and building data lakes;
  • Solid understanding of distributed computing frameworks (i.e. Spark, Hadoop) as well as SQL, NoSQL and graph databases;
  • 3+ years of software development experience in a high-responsibility, minimal-supervision environment;
  • Strong experience with writing modular, robust, scalable software in one of the major languages such as C++, Java, Python 3.x;
  • Strong experience with the Unix command line and bash scripting;
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative attitude.

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

item.title: DevOps Engineer
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an experienced Dev/Ops Support Engineer who will bring focus and subject-matter expertise around designing, implementing and supporting machine learning infrastructure and automation tools in production. This is a unique opportunity to grow in the world of machine learning infrastructure and work with a team of passionate individuals committed to the mission of bringing ML to enterprise.

 

At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, has access to rich and massive datasets, and offers the computational resources to support ongoing development in areas such as reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning and computer vision. You can find out more about our research areas at borealisai.com.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Providing production support and maintenance for ML applications;
  • Designing, building, and optimizing machine learning deployment tools and automation systems that operate the business’s data and ML applications;
  • Collaborating with engineers, and machine learning researchers to automate code analysis, build, integration and deployment of ML applications;
  • Supporting applications and projects with infrastructure design decisions, and monitoring solutions;
  • Building highly scalable, resilient cloud and on-premise systems for hosting machine learning systems using state-of-the-art technologies;;
  • Providing after-hours production support.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • Strong experience with Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps and production support;
  • Strong and relevant experience supporting and maintaining distributed systems;
  • Hands-on experience building and deploying virtualized environments in major cloud environments, such as Kubernetes, AWS and Azure;
  • Experience with building tools and applications to automate various infrastructure tasks (Jenkins, etc.);
  • Proficiency with programming languages such as Python, Bash, or JavaScript;
  • Experience implementing monitoring solutions to identify system bottlenecks and production issues;
  • Solid understanding of the UNIX operating system.

It would be great if you also have:

  • Knowledge of the machine learning application deployment process;
  • Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including testing methods, coding standards, code reviews and source control management;
  • Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, Theano, and/or similar.

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

item.title: Group Product Manager
item.description:
Available Locations
Toronto

What\'s the opportunity?

As a Group Product Manager on the Product team, you’ll get a chance to lead a portfolio of innovative AI products for the financial services industry and lead a team of machine learning product managers. You and your team will be responsible for building and delivering products that solve high-impact business and for defining strategic product roadmaps for your portfolio with the support of the business development, engineering, and research teams.

 

At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading machine learning researchers and software developers. Our mission is to think big and go beyond what’s possible today to deliver competitive AI products. This is a rare opportunity to build the skills required to make machine learning work in the enterprise. You can find out more about our research areas at www.borealisai.com.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Leading a portfolio of machine learning products within Capital Markets;
  • Defining and executing on both short and long-term product strategy and roadmaps;
  • Managing and developing a team of machine learning product managers;
  • Building and maintaining relationships with technical senior stakeholders within RBC Capital Markets;
  • Defining and delivering POCs and scaling these out into full-fledged products;
  • Guiding ideas from discovery-to-development-to-deployment in the Capital Markets Environment.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • You have 7+ years of experience working in capital market or a product role and 3 + years of management experience;
  • You have Master’s, or PhD degree in a technical or quantitative field;
  • You have strong product leadership skills and the ability to own a portfolio of products end-to-end independently. You have a track record of successful product deliveries;
  • You have strong foundations in finance and experience in global markets;
  • You are well versed with the core areas of applied machine learning and have experience with machine learning platforms and deploying models at scale;
  • You are an experienced people manager who can lead a high-performing team and ensure their continued development;
  • You are a strong collaborator and have the ability to influence both technical and business stakeholders;

item.title: Machine Learning Engineering Lead
item.description:
Available Locations
Toronto

What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an Engineering Manager to lead our Equities Returns Prediction team, being at the forefront of machine learning technology and working on extremely challenging problems. 

 

As a Machine Learning Engineering Lead, you’ll be responsible for owning and delivering a project end to end – everything from data pre-processing to implementing machine learning training pipelines and deploying inference in a production environment. You’ll be directly managing a team of machine learning engineers, responsible for strategic planning, execution and delivery. You will provide your team with technical leadership and mentorship. You will work along other engineering leads across Borealis AI. As a people manager you will be responsible for growing your team and fostering career growth of the engineers. 

Your responsibilities include:

  • Lead and directly manage a team of 4 engineers, being responsible for planning execution and delivery of ML systems; 
  • Establish high standards and share knowledge in performance, scalability, enterprise system architecture, and engineering best practices; 
  • Establish and maintain collaboration with research and business teams to converge on the best solutions; 
  • Extending prototypes into fully functional, polished solutions ready for internal and/or external use; 
  • Grow and develop the team, helping each team member advance in their career. 

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • Have 7+ years of experience delivering software projects to production; 
  • Have experience managing a team of engineers; 
  • Have experience developing modular, robust, scalable software in a modern programming language; 
  • Experience working with business, product and other technical teams; 
  • Experience with scaling and performance of large systems; 
  • Have led the full lifecycle of software product development including the successful deployment of products to production; 
  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software products, fostering career growth of software engineers, and establishing software engineering best practices within your team; 
  • Have background in machine learning or a related field; 
  • Experience with Capital Markets or any financial domain is a big plus. 

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential; 
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable; 
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities; 
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

item.title: Machine Learning Researcher
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

As a Machine Learning Researcher, you’re looking to channel your love of playing with real-world data into industry-disrupting solutions. We\'re a lab that supports research on a wide variety of theoretical and applied machine learning projects. Working in our lab will grant you unique access to massive structured and unstructured datasets with the tools and resources necessary to build game-changing statistical models.

 

Being part of our team means you’ll also have the opportunity to publish original research in peer-reviewed academic journals and participate in conferences around the world, such as NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR and more.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Developing novel AI solutions that facilitate impactful products;
  • Conducting original, publishable research by advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning techniques;
  • Working with the development team to transfer research work into production;
  • Interpreting larger organizational needs and designing algorithmic solutions that can drive the next generation of banking experiences;
  • Identifying relevant new AI technologies as they become available, and disseminating them into the bank’s technology capabilities.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A passion for solving open problems using data and algorithms;
  • A PhD in a sub-area of AI or demonstrated research track record by means of publications and/or sophisticated AI product experience;
  • Ability to formulate and drive a research project independently without close supervision;
  • Proficiency in Python and Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow or PyTorch.

What’s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

item.title: Machine Learning Researcher - Time Series
item.description:
What\'s the Opportunity?

Capital markets are known for their complex dynamics and intricate dependencies. As a Machine Learning Researcher in our capital markets team, you’re looking to channel your love of playing with real-world data into industry-disrupting solutions. Our team supports research on a wide variety of theoretical and applied machine learning projects, including game-changing studies on dynamic interactions between statistical models operating on a common source of data.

 

Working in capital markets will grant you unique access to massive structured and unstructured datasets with the tools and resources necessary to drive your vision. Being part of our team means you’ll also have the opportunity to publish original research in peer-reviewed academic journals and participate in conferences around the world, such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AISTATS and more.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Developing novel AI solutions that facilitate impactful products;
  • Conducting original, publishable research by advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning techniques;
  • Working with the development team to transfer research work into production;
  • Interpreting larger organizational needs and designing algorithmic solutions that can drive the next generation of banking experiences;
  • Identifying relevant new AI technologies as they become available, and disseminating them into the bank’s technology capabilities.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A PhD in a sub-area of AI or demonstrated research track record by means of publications;
  • A passion for solving open problems in areas such as time-series analysis, generative modelling, graph-based architectures, or multi-agent systems;
  • Proficiency in Python and Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow or PyTorch.
  • An eye for efficiency and experience with large-scale optimization on large-scale data.
  • [Bonus] Familiarity with C++ and network programming.
  • [Bonus] Familiarity with market microstructure, alpha research, or game theory.

What’s in it for you?

item.title: Technical Product Manager
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

Be a part of Borealis AI\'s success in delivering innovative products for RBC and pushing the boundaries in AI/ML product development. We are building a state-of-the-art ML platform that scales our team\'s ability to create, train and deliver trusted AI. You will be chiefly responsible for ensuring that this platform meets the needs of our internal customers and achieves broad adoption, working closely with engineering teams to deliver and iterate on the platform as we grow.

 

In addition, you will apply your previous expertise in Product Management & Ownership and ML Development to make the platform a highly successful product that accelerates teams within Borealis and with teams across RBC in their AI solution development. We\'re looking for a bold, tenacious, curious, and creative hands-on leader with proven experience at the intersection of Platform Product development and ML to join a highly talented team driving Borealis AI to be a leader in financial services AI. 

Your responsibilities include:

  • Working collaboratively with software, data, and infrastructural engineering teams to develop, prioritize, and maintain the feature backlog to deliver Borealis AI\'s Common Platform.
  • Working collaboratively with the Common Platform target users, Borealis AI product teams mix ML Software Engineers and AI Researchers to develop and maintain the product roadmap and strategy.
  • Form and maintain deep trusted relationships with RBC enterprise ML platform initiatives and the larger ML practitioner user groups, lines of business, functions, subject matter experts, delivery partners, architects, technology vendors and collaborating teams to grow the project\'s impact and scale of Borealis AI MLOps technology to RBC more broadly. 
  • Represent the voice of the end-user, and act as the authority on confirmed-value feature prioritization and feature acceptance.
  • Develop and execute the operational strategy for delivering the product management of the Common Platform itself. As part of this, drive and contribute to resource allocation, build vs buy strategic decisions, product marketing internal and external, and overall team performance, cohesion, and health. 

You’re our ideal candidate if you have: 

  • Demonstrable hands-on experience in the development of ML models, ideally with experience across both premise and cloud-based architectures. Specialist training in data science, ML or associated domains such as Computer Science.
  • Demonstrable experience in Product Management and Product Ownership.
  • Knowledge of and experience with one or more vendor or open-source MLOps platforms, and general familiarity with the challenges of developing, deploying and managing ML models.
  • Experience in leading without authority to garner the support and participation of colleagues across matrixed organizations.
  • Deadline-driven, organized and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high-quality standards while simultaneously handling various tasks and deadlines. They are motivated, driven and proactive but with a supportive and empathetic mindset.
  • Experience in driving team success through the continual development of exceptional OKRs.

Nice-to-have:

  • Post-graduate degree in Computer Science or other relevant technical disciplines.
  • Certified training in Agile and Scrum disciplines.
  • Experience in the application of Artificial Intelligence technologies in financial services sector products
  • Experience in the development of platform technologies to unlock an exceptional developer\'s experience. 

What\'s in it for you?

  • Opportunity to play a vital role in the development of leading-edge products.
  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach our full potential.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and management opportunities.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging, groundbreaking work.

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

item.title: Cloud Engineer
item.description:
A Leader in Automating Intelligent Industrial Operations

At Canvass Analytics, we are disrupting the way industrial operational data is being used to make critical business decisions. Our disruptive, leading edge AI-powered analytics platform transforms plant operations, giving them predictive insights that enable autonomous operations.

Canvass AI software platform is empowering Fortune 1,500industrial companies to transform industrial engineers into digital engineers who are driving data driven decisions in day to day operations. CanvassAnalytics’ customers include leading energy, manufacturing, food and ag, oil and gas, and metals and mining companies around the globe.

We’re an agile scale-up with the operational intelligence of a global business. As we accelerate rapidly, we are constantly looking for driven and ambitious innovators to join our team.

Things you should know about our product &teams

  • Our infrastructure is based on Kubernetes and various Azure cloud technologies
  • We use CircleCI to continuously integrate and deploy code changes
  • Deployment to production is git-based and happens on a regular basis
  • We use a micro services architecture built predominantly withPython
  • We’ve built data pipelines with Kafka and use Kube flow to orchestrate our machine learning pipeline
What we’re looking for:

We’re looking for candidates with:

  • A passion for building secure and scalable cloud infrastructure inAzure, AWS or GCP
  • Experience creating and managing Kubernetes clusters, using tools such as Helm and Terraform
  • Strong networking and Linux knowledge, including knowing what to look for when things go wrong
  • Proven track record of proactive system management and monitoring
  • An understanding of micro service architecture and distributed system design
  • Comfortable working with Python and Javascript
  • Bonus points for managing Kafka and/or Spark clusters​
​Who you are:

In general, we’re looking for engineers that exemplify these qualities:

  • Activation & Engagement Our engineers are critical to the progress of our application and our business. We expect our engineers to maintain focus on the business impact of their changes and advocate for work that will drive outcomes instead of just output.
  • Teamwork & Collaboration Our teams are small and extremely collaborative. You will work very closely with DevOps, ProductDevelopment and Customer Success to meaningfully impact the business every week.
  • Excellence & Craft Cloud infrastructure is more than just keeping the lights on 24/7. We need to build secure, scalable systems that are also easy to understand and easy to extend so that they can evolve with our business. We want our engineers to take pride in what they build.
  • Communication & Leadership An engineer can have a large impact by helping to grow the abilities and understanding of their teammates.We’re looking for people who can deliver learning sessions to introduce their technical teammates to new concepts and who can explain and contextualize their work to teammates outside of engineering.
Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Awesome team and culture (every day)
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Free team lunches
Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for theIndustrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange asa Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’sGradient Ventures.

What\'s it like working at Canvass?

This is a place where everyone is all in.  From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions.  We have an inclusive culture.

Apply Now

Think this job is meant for you but worried you don’t have it all?If you feel you meet 70% of the qualifications listed and you are an innovative team player, express your interest here and we promise to consider your full profile.

You can also follow us on Twitter or LinkedIn to learn more about us.

Canvass Analytics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

item.title: Product Marketing - Industry Lead
item.description:
A Leader in Automating Intelligent Industrial Operations

Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its cutting-edge AI platform, by transforming industrial engineers into data and digital engineers. Backed by some of the world’s largest companies like Google’s Gradient Ventures, Canvass is democratizing the use of AI in day to day operations so industrial companies can build AI/ML models at scale and deploy them in production to gain business benefits in real time.

​Job Description

Reporting to the VP of Marketing, you live and breathe product marketing and know the immense value this strategic function brings to an organization. Through your proven experience in B2B -SaaS product marketing, you have learned how to keep your eye on the big picture and execute on what needs to get done to move the needle.

We are looking for an experienced, collaborative, and driven Product Marketing Industry Lead, who will take Canvass AI to new heights and drive rapid growth across existing and new markets. You will be responsible for core go-to-market activism and ongoing product success - defining product positioning through a deep understanding of the market, buyers, and key competitors. You will synthesize information and serve as an internal and external evangelist and influencer to ensure the sales, marketing, and customer success are equipped with the right tools, knowledge, and information to properly position Canvass AI to win in the market.

Key Responsibilities

  • Conceptualize, build and analyze various marketing plans, strategies and campaigns to power the growth of Canvass AI’s brand and product.
  • Develop and launch campaigns to support our GTM (go to market) initiatives.
  • Develop targeted and meaningful content, product positioning and messaging that differentiates Canvass AI capabilities across the industry.
  • Communicate the value proposition of Canvass AI’s platform and capabilities to sales enablement and develop assets and sales tools that support the sales cycle.
  • Participate in the launch of new product releases and manage the cross-functional implementation of industry-agnostic plans.
  • Work closely with our Product Management and Go-To-Market teams to develop enablement content, product demos, sales tools and strategies.
  • Help drive market intelligence through in-depth industry and competitive analysis, while consistently devising programs to outpace the competition.
  • Develop the strategy and manage the marketing programs that drive demand within the industry.
  • Work with our broader marketing team to develop thought leadership and increase awareness of Canvass AI for expert data scientist user personas, influencers, and decision makers.
  • Create and maintain a crystal clear and highly compelling product messaging matrix.
  • Create and shape customer personas.
  • Track competitive marketing landscape against category.
  • Empower sales with competitive intelligence, and create and maintain competitor talking tracks, battle cards, cheat sheets, FAQs, and training.

Qualifications

  • SaaS product marketing experience is a must.
  • 8-10 years of work experience in B2B Product Marketing and/or Product Management.
  • Deep understanding of machine learning and analytic applications, especially in production / operational environments.
  • Demonstrated success in product launches and end-to-end execution of supporting marketing strategies.
  • Excellent communication skills a must; written and oral, including presentation and product demonstration experience to large and diverse audiences. You have a knack for developing compelling, differentiated, and memorable product narratives.
  • Analyst relations experience with firms such as Forrester and Gartner.
  • You enjoy collaborating with passionate cross-functional teams (e.g., sales, product management, marketing, customer success).
  • Roll up your sleeve get stuff done attitude with high growth start-up experience.
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field.

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Awesome team and culture (every day)
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Free team lunches

Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for the Industrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’s Gradient Ventures.

In general, we’re looking for a senior developer that exemplify these qualities:

Activation & Engagement Our developers are critical to the progress of our application and our business. We expect our developers to maintain focus on the business impact of their changes and advocate for work that will drive outcomes instead of just output.

‍Teamwork & Collaboration Our teams are small and extremely collaborative. Developers work very closely with a small number of other developers, a designer, and a product manager to meaningfully impact the business every week.

‍Excellence & Craft Software development is more than checking features off a list of requirements. We need our developers to build systems that are accessible to new teammates and extensible so that they can evolve with our business. We want our developers to take pride in what they build.

‍Communication & Leadership A developer can have a large impact by helping to grow the abilities and understanding of their teammates. We’re looking for people who can deliver learning sessions to introduce their technical teammates to new concepts and who can explain and contextualize their work to teammates outside of engineering.

What’s in it for you

You want to join a company that’s at the forefront of leading edge technology and you want to be the person that takes us there and captures massive market share. You want to be part of an ambitious, successful team that is rapidly scaling up, that gives you room to grow and build your career as the company grows.  

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • An incredible team with Inclusive culture, open to ideas
  • You build the future of the planet. An opportunity to work in a leading edge AI company that is making the planet safer and greener for the future.  
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with option to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Equity Plan
What\'s it like working at Canvass

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions. We have an inclusive culture and we are driven by the passion to make an impact to the future of the industrial sector which in turn impacts the climate sustainability.

item.title: Finance Manager
item.description:
Canvass AI, A Leader in Industrial AI, Seeks Finance Manager

Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its leading AI platform by enabling operators to scale the use of machine learning in their day-to-day production to gain immediate business benefits. Funded by Alphabet’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Motor Ventures, Canvass is democratizing access to AI by requiring little or no data science knowledge to use it. Global companies are employing Canvass AI today to achieve higher quality, lower cost, less disruption while reducing waste and emissions.

Role:

As a Finance Manager you will be responsible for the financial operations of Canvass. Producing financial reports and developing strategies based on financial research. Guiding senior executives in making sound business decisions in the long and short term. This position reports to the CEO.

Location: Toronto, Ontario or remote

Key Responsibilities:

  • Monitor the day-to-day financial operations within the company (payroll, invoicing, and other transactions)
  • Prepare monthly and quarterly management reporting
  • Provide insightful information and expectations to senior leadership to aid in long-term and short-term decision-making
  • Support project analysis, validation of plans and product pricing, and ad-hoc requests
  • Manage the company\'s financial accounting, HR platform, monitoring, and reporting systems
  • Contract and oversee outside services for tax preparation, accounting, payroll, auditing, banking, investments, recruiting, SR&ED claims, and other financial and HR needs as necessary
  • Track the company’s financial status and operating performance to identify areas for potential improvement
  • Present financial reports to board members, stakeholders, executives, and clients in formal meetings
  • Ensure compliance with accounting policies and regulatory requirements

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Finance or Accounting; CPA a plus
  • 2-3 years of combined experience in accounting, financial analysis
  • Experience with software scale-ups is preferred
  • Ability to synthesize data into actionable information
  • Ability to work and effectively communicate with senior-level business partners
  • Excellent business judgment, analytical, and decision-making skills
  • Knowledge of financial reporting and data mining tools
  • Strong demonstrated use of Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
  • Solid communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Deep understanding of business principles and practices
  • Integrity, honesty

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Extended learning via Coursera account
  • Flexible work policy, with options to work remotely
  • Stock options as part of your compensation
  • Attend conferences and training courses to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Latest technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Team lunches
‍Why join Canvass?

Canvass AI is changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Start-ups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company.

​What’s it like working at Canvass?

This is a place where everyone is all in.  From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions.  We have an inclusive culture.

item.title: Instructional Designer
item.description:
Canvass AI, A Leader in Industrial AI, Seeks Instructional Designer

Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its leading AI platform by enabling operators to scale the use of machine learning in their day-to-day production to gain immediate business benefits. Funded by Alphabet’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Motor Ventures, Canvass is democratizing access to AI by requiring little or no data science knowledge to use it. Global companies are employing Canvass AI today to achieve higher quality, lower cost, less disruption while reducing waste and emissions.

Our mission is to empower industrials to build a profitable and sustainable future by transforming the way they use data.

The Role

Canvass is looking for an Instructional Designer to drive the development of creative learning solutions to facilitate customer use and adoption of Canvass Analytics’ industry leading AI software platform.  Your focus will be creating engaging multi-media educational experiences for our clients within our self-paced online learning portal.

The role includes collaborating with Marketing, Product Management, and Customer Success personnel to develop quality online material that supports active learning of the Canvass AI Platform.

The Ideal Candidate

You are a creative, passionate educator who understands adult learners coupled with the opportunities and challenges presented by online learning.  You are an organized, innovative self-starter, willing to take on new challenges, build new skills and help power a start-up to its next level.  You work well in teams and are comfortable with collaboration and joint problem solving.  You are a proactive thinker, constantly seeking improvement opportunities in work and possess the ability to simplify complex information.

Qualifications:
  • Minimum three-year Diploma/Degree in Web Development, Information Technology, Computer Science, Math, Multimedia, Graphic Design, Online Learning, or Education
  • Minimum two years experience writing, planning, executing, and delivering online learning (ideally for a software product) including overall establishing learning objectives, understanding learner profiles, and developing course outlines.
  • Experience creating highly engaging educational content using text, images, audio, video, and other technologies.
  • Proven skill working with subject matter experts
  • Strong listening and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail & organizational skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including editorial skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to form successful relationships and collaborate with colleagues at all levels of the organization
  • Demonstrated success in managing multiple projects and competing priorities
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment with constant change and a rapidly growing team
Key Responsibilities:
  • Design and develop course content, provide eLearning guidance and liaise with key stakeholders and subject matter experts to establish course objectives and design
  • Partner with key stakeholders to manage design/build documents and templates around highly engaging and interactive eLearning that meets company standards and learner needs
  • Create and manage reporting mechanisms to track compliance, learning objectives and key metrics
  • Educate and mentor peers on the use of a LMS and course authoring tools
  • Demonstrate expertise across all fields to deliver high value, on-demand training
  • Use innovative techniques and creative delivery mechanisms to reach a dispersed staff and multilingual customers and adopt new technologies as they arrive
  • Develop and prepare presentation materials; write, direct, edit videos and voice overs
  • Define and implement success measures for the Canvass customer education program

Location: Toronto, Ontario or remote

Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Online learning via Coursera account
  • Flexible work policy, with options to work remotely
  • Stock options as part of your compensation
  • Attend conferences and training courses to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided laptops and standing desks
  • Latest technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Team lunches
Why join Canvass?

Canvass AI is changing the way industry thinks about and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Start-ups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. With Canvass AI you have the opportunity to not only change an industry but also save the planet by helping industrials achieve their net zero goals.

​What’s it like working at Canvass?

This is a place where everyone is all in.  You’re not a cog with us. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions.  We have an inclusive culture.

item.title: Content Writer (Data Science & Engineering) (Remote, Americas)
item.description:
About the role

We are looking for an experienced and creative Content Writer to join our Data Science & Engineering Programs team. You’ll work under the team’s brand and communication arm, responsible for building the Shopify Data brand both externally and internally. In this role, you’ll be responsible for writing and editing data-centric content that highlights the awesome work the team is driving forward. You’ll do this by working closely with Shopify data scientists and engineers to identify and craft stories for our blog, while also partnering with internal marketing teams to create and amplify technical-first content.

To be successful in this role, you must be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, writing technically, storytelling, being goal-oriented, managing multiple projects, and building relationships. You work well under pressure, understand what motivates data scientists and engineers, have a keen eye for great stories, and can both set and deliver on hard deadlines while simultaneously thriving in a changing environment. You are obsessed with taking technical content and transforming it into engaging stories.

If you love storytelling and are an experienced technical writer, join our team!

Responsibilities:

  • Write and edit technical, data-centred content for the Shopify Data blog 

  • Collaborate with internal marketing teams to create and review technical-focused marketing content (e.g. social copy, landing page copy, video scripts...)

  • Work closely with Shopify data scientists and engineers to identify and write key technical stories that we should be sharing externally

  • Create and manage a content funnel, intake process and strategy for data-centered stories

  • Build relationships across Shopify Data, Engineering, and Marketing

Qualifications

Requirements for the role:

  • Strong writing and editing skills based on past experience in a technical writing or editorial role

  • Exceptional storytelling skills and ability to identify interesting stories

  • Ability to quickly grasp the fundamentals of a technology and turn it into a long-form story, or distill it into a few words.

  • Can own the creation of a technical piece of content from intake interview with subject matter expert, to ideation, to final copy.

  • A commitment to understanding our data audiences’ needs 

  • Well-versed in building and managing a network of subject matter experts and stakeholders at multiple levels

  • High standards, an obsessive eye for detail, and a strong sense of ownership

  • Demonstrated ability to manage and deliver on deadlines

  • A self-starter who takes initiative and is excited to problem-solve

  • Proven ability to thrive on change

Bonus experience

  • Experience managing or writing for a technical blog

  • Background in data science or engineering

Top Drawer Challenge:

Choose your own adventure (choose one of the below):

  1. In 500 words, please write a post re-introducing the algorithm behind Shopify Capital. You should explain what Shopify Capital is and how data drives the product. Please spend no more than 1 hour on this!

  2. Go to our blog and find an article that you think could be made better with a few tweaks. Explain what’s missing, how the story could flow better or how you would write it differently. 

Application Timeline:

We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. We are looking forward to reading your application. This posting will close on December 17th.

At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous people, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.
 

​​​​

 

How we hire

At Shopify, we put a lot of care and time into who we hire. We believe that in order to build the best products, we need to build high impact teams. Our recruitment process centres around what we call the Life Story interview, a conversational-style interview where we get to learn more about you.
Learn more about our hiring process

item.title: Senior Data Engineer (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Our Data Platform Engineering group builds and maintains the platform that delivers accessible data to power decision-making at Shopify for millions of merchants. We’re hiring high-impact developers across teams:

  • The Engine group organizes all merchant and Shopify data into our data lake in highly-optimized formats for fast query processing, and maintaining the security + quality of our datasets.
  • The Analytics group builds products that leverage the Engine primitives to deliver simple and useful products that power scalable transformation of data at Shopify in batch, or streaming, or for machine learning. This group is focused on making it really simple for our users to answer three questions: What happened in the past? What is happening now? And, what will happen in the future?  
  • The Data Experiences group builds end-user experiences for experimentation, data discovery, and business intelligence reporting.
  • The Reliability group operates the data platform efficiently in a consistent and reliable manner. They build tools for other teams at Data Platform to leverage to encourage consistency and they champion reliability across the platform.

Qualifications

While our teams value specialized skills, they\'ve also got a lot in common. We\'re looking for a(n): 

  • High-energy self-starter with experience and passion for data and big data scale processing. You enjoy working in fast-paced environments and love making an impact. 
  • Exceptional communicator with the ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand language for our stakeholders. 
  • Excitement for working with a remote team; you value collaborating on problems, asking questions, delivering feedback, and supporting others in their goals whether they are in your vicinity or entire cities apart.
  • Solid software engineer: experienced in building and maintaining systems at scale.

A Senior Data Developer at Shopify typically has 4-6 years of experience in one or more of the following areas:

  • Working with the internals of a distributed compute engine (Spark, Presto, DBT, or Flink/Beam)
  • Query optimization, resource allocation and management, and data lake performance (Presto, SQL)
  • Cloud infrastructure (Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Terraform)
  • Security products and methods (Apache Ranger, Apache Knox, OAuth, IAM, Kerberos)
  • Deploying and scaling ML solutions using open-source frameworks (MLFlow, TFX, H2O, etc.)
  • Building full-stack applications (Ruby/Rails, React, TypeScript)
  • Background and practical experience in statistics and/or computational mathematics (Bayesian and Frequentist approaches, NumPy, PyMC3, etc.)
  • Modern Big-Data storage technologies (Iceberg, Hudi, Delta)




    #Senior Software Developer- Distributed Systems #Senior Software Developer- Data Engineering #Senior Data App Developer #Senior Data Reliability Engineer #Senior Software Developer- Reliability

At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous people, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.

Shopify is now permanently remote and working towards a future that is digital by design. Learn more

item.title: Data Science Manager (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Data is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. 

We are looking for Data Science Managers to join our Data Science teams and help shape the insights and algorithms that will inform our strategies as we grow globally.  

What your role will look like:

  • Partner closely with product, engineering and other RnD stakeholders to guide their decisions using data

  • Proactively identify and champion projects that solve complex problems across multiple domains

  • Apply specialized skills and fundamental data science methods (e.g. experimental design, recommender systems and machine learning when needed) to inform improvements to our business

  • Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines: work closely with stakeholders to build  models, tables or schemas that support business processes

  • Empower teams to build and maintain actionable KPIs, production-quality dashboards, informative deep dives, and scalable data products

 

Qualifications

You will need to have:

  • 7-10 years of commercial experience as in a data science role solving high impact business problems, including 3+ years leading and maintaining high performance data science teams
  • Experience building and managing high performance data science teams
  • Experience delivering business impact through analysis and data products
  • Experience building data pipelines and driving ETL design decisions
  • Technical leadership and management experience (you enjoy doing both).  You can jump into the code to the level that your direct reports admire and respect, but are also interested in developing people and capacity for your team
  • Experience creating data product strategies, shipping data products, iterating after launch, and trying again
  • Extensive experience using Python including a strong grasp of object oriented programming (OOP) fundamentals
  • Strong ability to prioritize and communicate to technical and non-technical audiences alike

It would be great if you have:

  • Previous experience using Spark (either via Scala or Pyspark)
  • Experience with statistical methods like regression, GLMs or experiment design and analysis, shipping productionized machine learning systems or other advanced techniques are also welcome
  • Experience with data storytelling using Tableau, QlikView, Mode, Matplotlib, D3, or similar data visualization tools

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce at Shopify, click the “Apply Now” button to submit your application. Please submit a resume and cover letter with your application. Make sure to tell us how you think you can make an impact at Shopify, and what drew you to the role. 

At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. item.description:

  • The Engine group organizes all merchant and Shopify data into our data lake in highly-optimized formats for fast query processing, and maintaining the security and quality of our datasets.

  • The Data Experiences group builds end-user experiences for experimentation, data discovery, and business intelligence reporting.

  • The Reliability group operates the data platform in a consistent and reliable manner. They build tools for other teams on Data Platform to leverage and encourage consistency as they champion reliability across the platform.

Your role:

  • Providing people and technical leadership within your team to support the mission of the Data Platform Engineering group. 

  • Working closely with a cross-functional team of product leaders, engineering leaders, and distributed system engineers to influence the organizational vision and help solve hard problems in scaling the data platform.

  • Strategic and tactical deliverables for your team.

  • Deploying the team towards data platform priorities, achieving measurable impact and outcomes.

  • Defining and executing on your team’s deliverables.

  • Sourcing and hiring for positions in your team or organization.

  • All aspects of performance management, including compensation, performance improvement plans, promotions, and separations.

Qualifications

About You:

  • An experienced manager of teams of high-performing engineers.

  • Technical engineering background in one or more areas listed in the next section.

  • A proven track record of delivering impactful results.

  • Exceptional communication skills and ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand language for our stakeholders. 

  • Excitement for working with a remote team; you value collaborating on problems, asking questions, delivering feedback, and supporting others in their goals whether they are in your vicinity or entire cities apart.

A Data Development Manager at Shopify would typically have at least 2 years of experience leading high-functioning teams, and expertise in one or more of the following areas:

  • Experience with the internals of a distributed compute engine (Spark, Presto, DBT, or Flink/Beam)

  • Experience in query optimization, resource allocation and management, and data lake performance (Presto, SQL)

  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Terraform)
    Experience with security products and methods (Apache Ranger, Apache Knox, OAuth, IAM, Kerberos)

  • Experience deploying and scaling ML solutions using open-source frameworks (MLFlow, TFX, H2O, etc.)

  • Experience building full-stack applications (Ruby/Rails, React, TypeScript)

  • Background and practical experience in statistics and/or computational mathematics (Bayesian and Frequentist approaches, NumPy, PyMC3, etc.)

  • Modern Big-Data storage technologies (Iceberg, Hudi, Delta)

At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous people, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.

Shopify is now permanently remote and working towards a future that is digital by design. Learn more

#LI-REMOTE

How we hire

At Shopify, we put a lot of care and time into who we hire. We believe that in order to build the best products, we need to build high impact teams. Our recruitment process centres around what we call the Life Story interview, a conversational-style interview where we get to learn more about you.

item.title: Staff Data Engineer (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Our Data Platform Engineering group builds and maintains the platform that delivers accessible data to power decision-making at Shopify for millions of merchants. We’re hiring high-impact developers across teams:

  • The Engine group organizes all merchant and Shopify data into our data lake in highly-optimized formats for fast query processing, and maintaining the security and quality of our datasets.

  • The Analytics group leverages the Engine primitives to build and deliver simple and useful products that power scalable transformation of data at Shopify in batch, streaming, or for machine learning. This group is focused on making it really simple for our users to answer three questions: What happened in the past? What is happening now? And, what will happen in the future?  

  • The Data Experiences group builds end-user experiences for experimentation, data discovery, and business intelligence reporting.

  • The Reliability group operates the data platform in a consistent and reliable manner. They build tools for other teams on Data Platform to leverage and encourage consistency as they champion reliability across the platform.

  • Technical engineering background in one or more areas in the next section.

  • Exceptional communication skills and ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand language for our stakeholders. 

  • Excitement for working with a remote team; you value collaborating on problems, asking questions, delivering feedback, and supporting others in their goals whether they are in your vicinity or entire cities apart.
