item.title: Senior Account Manager, Networking - Canada
item.description:
Do you want to join a fun, creative company that is on the cutting edge of amazing technologies? NVIDIA’s fast-growing Datacenter Networking Business (a merger of NVIDIA, Mellanox, and Cumulus) is looking for a strong Senior Account Manager who will bring technical and business insight to help grow the Ethernet & Infiniband switch business in Canada.

What you’ll be doing:

  • You will be an integral part of a small, nimble team that is responsible for a significant and rapidly growing recurring revenue contribution to the Enterprise products group, the fastest growing and most dynamic segment at NVIDIA.

  • Working with the channel team to build alliances and expand our quality channels.

  • Partnering with the technical team on designs, competition etc.

  • Being the link between the overlay team and the field (roadmap updates, tech communications…).

  • Define and drive the discussions, strategy and be the specialist in the team, enabling our key partners to drive Networking solutions sales.

  • Delivering a concise state of the business in the region at any given time.

What we need to see:

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in related field (or equivalent experience).

  • 6+ years of technical sales or Product Management background in the Ethernet market.

  • Experience from Ethernet switch companies – advantage.

  • Excellent communication skills in English. Additionally French will be an advantage.

  • An understanding of the business issues of large enterprises (FSI, Healthcare, Manufacturing, etc) Networking/Switching/Data Center technology background.

  • Self-starter, with a ‘can-do’ attitude and ability to multitask and prioritize in a demanding environment.

  • Travel is required.

  • Excellent communication and presentation abilities. Excellent interpersonal skills, peer networking and team play, colleagues and customers.

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Strong Background in modern Data Center networking.

  • Experience with deep learning, data science, and NVIDIA GPUs.

  • Successful management of technical products throughout their lifecycle

  • Love technology and passionate about what you do.

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. Are you creative and autonomous? Do you love a challenge? If so, we want to hear from you. Come, join our Datacenter communication Infrastructure team and help us build the scalable communication platforms driving our success in this dynamic and quickly growing field.

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other

item.title: Senior Deep Learning Algorithm Engineer
item.description:
We are now looking for a Senior Deep Learning Algorithms Software Engineer.

NVIDIA is seeking software engineers for its Deep Learning Algorithms team to develop and commercialize Artificial Intelligence solutions to diverse real-world problems related to NLP, Computer Vision, Speech, Text, Recommendation Systems etc. Academic and commercial groups around the world are using GPUs to redefine AI and data analytics, and to power data centers. Come and help the team building the software which will be used globally. You will have a unique opportunity to interact with the scientific community to implement and improve the latest AI algorithms.

If you have a good understanding of deep learning and a strong algorithmic background, with exposure to computer architecture and performance, then this role may be a great fit for you! Collaborate and interact with internal partners, users, and members of the open source community to analyze, define and implement highly optimized AI algorithms. The scope of these efforts includes a combination of implementing new algorithms, performance/accuracy tuning and analysis, defining APIs, analyzing functionality coverage, and other general software engineering work. The ability to work in a dynamic, product-centric environment with excellent interpersonal skills are required, to be successful in this role.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Develop algorithms for deep learning, data analytics, machine learning, or scientific computing

  • Construct and curate large problem specific datasets

  • Analyze and improve performance of GPU implementations

  • Collaborate with team members and other partners

  • Publish state-of-the-art results on Github and scientific publications

  • Keep up with the latest DL research and collaborate with diverse teams (internal and external to NVIDIA), including DL researchers, hardware and software engineers

What we need to see:

  • PhD or Master\'s Degree or equivalent experience

  • 3+ years industry experience in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Applied Math, or related field

  • Strong Mathematical fundamentals and algorithms skills or experience

  • Excellent programming, debugging, performance analysis, and test design skills

  • Ability to work independently and manage individuals’ R&D efforts

  • Good communication and documentation habits

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • A Masters or PhD in Computer Science, AI, Applied Math, or related field

  • 5 years of experience with Deep Learning Frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, MXNet)

  • Excellent C/C++ and Python programming skills

  • GPU programming (CUDA or OpenCL)

  • Experience doing performance analysis and tuning

  • Exposure to HW architecture, ideally accelerators, and to numerical software

  • Project management tools (e.g. JIRA, Git, Microsoft Project)

Does the idea of pushing the boundaries of state-of-the-art research and development excite you? Interested in getting exposure to the entire DL SW stack? Then come join us and help build the GPU-accelerated DL platform used worldwide. NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people on the planet working for us. If you\'re creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!

#deeplearning

item.title: Compute Performance Developer Technology Engineer - CUDA
item.description:
Compute Performance Developer Technology Engineer.

NVIDIA is hiring passionate, world-class computer scientists to work in its Compute Developer Technology (Devtech) team.

What you will be doing:

In this role, you will research and develop techniques to GPU-accelerate leading applications in high performance computing fields within scientific computing, computational engineering, and data science. You will be performing in-depth analysis and optimization to ensure the best possible performance on current and next-generation GPU architectures. This involves:

  • Working directly with key application developers to understand the current and future problems they are solving, crafting and optimizing core parallel algorithms and data structures to provide the best solutions using GPUs, through both reference code development and direct contribution to the applications.
  • Collaborating closely with diverse groups at NVIDIA such as the architecture, research, libraries, tools, and system software teams to influence the design of next-generation architectures, software platforms, and programming models, by investigating the impact on application performance and developer productivity.
  • You will need to travel from time to time for conferences and for on-site visits with developers.

What we need to see:

  • A BS, MS, or PhD degree from a leading university in an engineering or computer science related discipline with 3+ years of relevant experience. While not a requirement, domain expertise in telecommunications, medical imaging, machine learning, deep learning, or natural sciences is helpful.
  • Programming fluency in C/C++ and/or Fortran with a deep understanding of software design, programming techniques, and algorithms.
  • Strong mathematical fundamentals, including linear algebra and numerical methods.
  • Experience with parallel programming, ideally CUDA C/C++ and OpenACC.
  • Strong communication and organization skills, with a logical approach to problem solving, good time management, and task prioritization skills.

With highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology industry\'s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working with us and our engineering teams are growing fast in some of the hottest and state of the art fields: Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Autonomous Vehicles, Supercomputing and more. Are you a creative and autonomous computer scientist with a real passion for parallel computing? If so, we want to hear from you.

#deeplearning

item.title: Software Engineer, Omniverse - New College Grad
item.description:
For two decades, we have pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics. With our invention of the GPU - the engine of modern visual computing - the field has grown to encompass video games, movie production, product design, medical diagnosis and scientific research. Today, we stand at the beginning of the next era, the AI computing era, ignited by a new computing model, GPU deep learning. This new model - where deep neural networks are trained to recognize patterns from massive amounts of data - has shown to be deeply effective at solving the most complex problems in everyday life.

We are looking for a Software Engineer to further the development of our high-performance compute graph – OmniGraph - on top of our Omniverse platform.

What you\'ll be doing:

  • Key member involved in the design, development, optimization, and documentation of our OmniGraph project for our Omniverse platform

  • Ensuring a high level of architectural quality, performance in the developed code and features

  • Debugging and fixing deficiencies

  • Support members of other teams / clients as they adopt the technology developed

  • Support the technology on multiple hardware platforms.

  • Partnering and collaborating with peers and managers

What we need to see:

  • Strong Python and C++ skills

  • Graduating or will recently graduate from BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience

  • Minimum 1+year of relevant experience

  • Experience working in large scale code bases/ projects

  • A solid sense of software architecture

  • Proven ability to optimize code / data for performance

  • Phenomenal team player and collaborator

  • Excellent verbal and written communication

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Experience with CUDA or GPU

  • Knowledge with computer graphics

  • Knowledge / experience with HPC architectures

  • Experience withcompilers

  • Understanding of USD

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. Are you creative and autonomous? Do you love the challenge of crafting the highest performance & lowest power silicon possible? If so, we want to hear from you.

item.title: Senior Performance Engineer
item.description:
As a Performance Engineer, you will be responsible for the maintenance, development and execution of performance analysis for the world’s fastest, power efficient GPUs. This job involves various challenges such as working on pre-production hardware, software and other emerging technologies.

You should be passionate about the newest graphics and gaming technology developments and are a PC benchmark hobbyist at heart. Do you love the tech industry, gaming, benchmarking and have experience in automation and/or testing? If so, we’d like to hear from you!

What you\'ll be doing:

  • Designing and developing testing automation and software tools.

  • Working with and debugging pre-production software and hardware.

  • Implementing special test environments such as thermal controlled testing.

  • Analyzing performance data and taking those findings to write concise reports to technical and non-technical audiences.

What we need to see:

  • A Bachelor’s degree, Master’s degree, or equivalent experience in a technical or business marketing field.

  • 3+ years of experience.

  • Demonstrable programming experience in Python (through work or education).

  • HW and SW debugging ability.

  • Practiced in HW bring-up (building/upgrading a desktop or notebook).

  • Advanced Windows experience.

  • Ability to work as part of a team and with technical and non-technical co-workers.

  • Strong verbal and written communication.

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Linux background

  • Embedded platform experience

  • Familiar with NVIDIA\'s products and technologies

  • Growth mindset and constantly trying to pick up new skills and knowledge.

With highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world\'s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us and, due to unprecedented growth, our special engineering teams are growing fast. If you\'re a creative and autonomous engineer with a real passion for technology, we want to hear from you.

item.title: Performance Engineer, Gaming
item.description:
We are looking for an avid game enthusiast! NVIDIA has continuously pioneered and reinvented itself over two decades through various avenues of computing: Graphics, High Performance Computing, Artificial Intelligence, Research, and more.

Our invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing. NVIDIA is a “learning machine” that constantly evolves by adapting to new opportunities that are hard to tackle, that only we can solve, and that matter to the world. This is our life’s work, to amplify human creativity, intelligence, and technology. Today, visual computing is becoming increasingly central to how people interact with technology, and there has never been a more exciting time to join our team.

We are looking for a Performance Engineer, who will assemble computer hardware, develop and run automation scripts on applications and design tools to better provide performance information. The ideal candidate is a game enthusiast with a good understanding of in-game settings and graphics technologies, know NVIDIA products and its characteristics. Experience and real passion for PC games is widely welcome.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Run performance, image quality and power tests of PC games and benchmark applications on various GPUs.

  • Generate statistics based on performance data, identify and investigate outliers and monitor performance trends.

  • Build scripts to bench marking procedure and balance configuration files.

  • Design new tools and the best process to accomplish task on efficient approach.

  • Build and configure computer systems with appropriate hardware and software to run benchmarks.

  • Be a source of knowledge and mentor for junior engineers.

What we need to see:

  • Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.

  • 4+ years experience in a software development or test organization.

  • Deep understanding in the field 3D application performance testing methods and techniques.

  • Experienced and passionate about PC games.

  • Good knowledge of PC systems and components.

  • Excellent designing, programming and debugging skills in a scripting language; Python preferred.

  • Good partnership and interpersonal skills.

  • Highly organized and self-driven, with the ability to work in a dynamic environment across multiple countries.

Ways for you to stand out from the crowd:

  • Proven experience as team leader.

  • Strong skills in benchmarking and competitive analysis.

  • Experience with testing automation for any kind of applications.

With highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world\'s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us and, due to unprecedented growth, our special engineering teams are growing fast. If you\'re a creative and autonomous engineer with a real passion for technology, we want to hear from you.

item.title: Design Specialist II - DevOps Wireless Network Engineer
item.description:
Description

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.

 
Join our team

 
The Wireless Networks and Service Dev Ops is an operational team that works with all aspects of Engineering and our clients to ensure that TELUS continues to deliver on its best network commitment, backed by third party awards such as Ookla\'s "#1 in Mobile Network Speed in Ontario", PC Mag\'s "Canada\'s Fastest Mobile Network" and Open Signal\'s "Fastest Overall Download Speed". 

We are always looking for new ways to identify and resolve network problems through innovation. 

With the increasing complexity of radio systems and the advent of 5G wireless technology, you will have the opportunity not only to master new technologies, but also apply modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning to build a wireless network that delivers excellence in network performance.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 


You will be an integral part of the Wireless Networks and Service Dev Ops in Ontario, developing tools and best practices to support network performance and troubleshooting network issues through call flow analysis. Your passion and experience in telecommunications will help shape how we continue to achieve our best network standing in Ontario and will have a direct impact on the growth of the 5G network.

 

Here\'s how 


• Network KPI and call flow analysis
• Participate in the development of tools and dashboards to analyze wireless network KPIs in search of network issues that impact the client experience
• Apply your knowledge in data science, such as big data analytics and advance automation opportunities that improve the team’s efficiency in find root causes of network issues
• Use your knowledge of network virtualization and cloud computing platforms to design and grow a 5G network 
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams like Technology Strategy and Product Development to understand new technologies and services to prepare our team to succeed in an evolving business environment such as 5G and IoT
• Analyze dashboards and create data visualizations: You will provide insight into client experience that can be shared with executives, peer groups and tools that are implemented in customer portals
• Help to proactively identify network problems and avoid client issues on the wireless network, by introducing automation. 
• Participate in small to medium size projects which require analytics or capability development (such as analysis, reporting or platform)
• Apply your knowledge of GIS (geographic information system) technology to geo-locate network problems 
 

Qualifications

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 
• With 3 to 5 years’ of experience working in RF Engineering, data science, computer science or related field
• Recognized for your passion for developing tools and using data analytics to improve network KPIs
• Hands on experience with network virtualization and cloud computing platforms such as Open Stack 
• Acknowledged for your strong understanding of databases and big data, including MySQL, NoSQL databases (such as MongoDB, Netezza, Splunk, Hadoop)
• Hands on experience with data analytics tools like Tableau, Alteryx
• Demonstrated innovation to introduce change for improvement in work efficiency and cost savings 
• Valued for your ability to consult and communicate with various levels of management
• With your valid G driver’s license or other provincial equivalent
• Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering

 

Great-to-haves

 
• Understanding of 3GPP (LTE/5G), radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
• Experience in the field of data science/big data analytics
• Telecommunications experience 
• Programming experience with C#, JavaScript, Python, Perl
• With your basic understanding of GIS technology (such as MapInfo, ArcGIS)

item.title: RF Design Specialist II
item.description:
Description

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.

 

Join our team

 

The wireless engineering team is a group of highly motivated and talented RF Engineers who have a passion for deploying the network infrastructure to achieve best in class network services to our customers. We are the team that engineer our 5G national RAN network.

The team is always at the cutting edge of wireless technology delivering the newest and the best services to our customers. With the advent of 5G, you will have the opportunity to work with peer RF Engineers to design the network while leveraging your automation, data science, and machine learning skills.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As an Engineer II, you will collaborate with peer RF Engineers and provide technical support to ensure we efficiently deploy network infrastructure to meet the increasing customer demand for wireless services.

Your efforts will ensure that our millions of customers are able to enjoy a world class wireless network experience. Your creativity coupled with strong automation and big-data analytical skills will allow us to find the most efficient ways of building our wireless network to support existing mobility services and offer future new services.  We are searching for an engineer with extensive experience in both Macro RAN & Microwave RF design. 

 

Here’s how

 

•    Using RF propagation modelling, you will develop novel techniques to simulate wireless coverage supporting the evolution of our networks (5G and IoT)
•    Collaborating with internal teams like Technology Strategy and Product Development to understand new technologies and services to prepare our team to succeed in an evolving business environment
•    Lead the implementation of wireless capacity augments, you will build working processes with performance and construction teams to drive improvements in customer experience
•    Developing dashboards and data visualizations you will provide insight into network performance that can be shared with executives, peer groups and tools that are implemented in customer portals 
•    Keeping up-to-date with software, data science, and RF technologies while proposing new ideas for platforms and tools
 

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

•    Bachelors degree in electrical engineering
•    Distinguished for your 5-years minimum experience in a RF engineering team (specifically with Macro RAN designs)
•    With a deep insight of industry standard propagation tools (ex. Planet, ATOLL) 
•    Respected for your knowledge of 3GPP (LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
•    Recognized for your strong understanding of databases and big data including MySQL, NoSQL databases, SPLUNK, Python and Alteryx
•    Valued for your effective communication skills while collaborating with both technical and non-technical team members
•    Commended for your inter-personal skills, critical thinking, analytical, and problem solving skills
•    Passionate about automation, data science, and machine learning

 

Great-to-haves

 

•    Masters degree in Engineering or Computer Science
•    Knowledge of Tableau, Splunk or Alteryx
•    Experience with some of the following programming languages: C/C++, Java
•    Experience with SQL, database design and development (MySQL, SQL Server, PostgreSQL Oracle, Hadoop, MongoDB…)

item.title: Design Specialist II - Packet Core
item.description:
Description

Make your mark on the leading edge of next-generation wireless networks and technologies!

 

Join our team

 

 

The Wireless Core Network Services DevOps team is at the forefront of driving strategy for the next generation of networks and technologies such as 5G, IoT, AI, and Virtualization. This team gets involved with the fundamentals of what the strategy is and how we can achieve it. Team Members are often considered innovators as they develop and enhance network designs aimed at improving client service reliability for core mobility services. The team incorporates passion and technical prowess to be highly effective in their risk mitigation and delivery. Often being met by difficult decisions, they remain invested in what they do and believe in what they are creating for the future.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

 

As a DevOps Engineer, you will drive strategy for 4G, 5G and the automation program for our core network infrastructure and services. Your creativity coupled with strong automation, data science, machine learning, and computer networking skills will allow us to find the most efficient ways of building and operating our wireless core network to support existing mobility infrastructure and offer new services.

You will use your creative vision to change the way TELUS leverages technology. Collectively, the passion we have to transform the Network landscape will remain a leading factor in why customers continue to recognize TELUS as the fastest and most reliable network in Canada.

 

Here’s how

 


•    Design, develop and integrate network functions in 5G and 4G in a virtualized infrastructure running Openstack/Openshift
•    Design, Intergrate and maintain the Lawful Intercept Platform
•    Investigate and implement opportunities to leverage automation for the mobility core network and services
•    Implement machine learning algorithms and develop system APIs
•    Support the delivery of Technology and Automation in Testing, CI/CD pipline, alarming
•    Support the Operation of the network and participate in operational improvement initiatives, in conjunction with other technology teams in the company

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle


•    3+ years of relevant professional experience 
•    Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering
•    Familiar with Agile and CI/CD pipeline
•    Experience in the wireless core network, especially EPC (Evolved Packet Core – PGW, MME, DRA), IoT, NFV, SDN, 5G 
•    Experience with working with Lawful Intercept platform 
•    Experience in network systems & process automation using DevOps tools and programming/scripting languages such as JavaScript, PowerShell, Python, Unix shell, Ansible, Jenkins, GitLAB
•    Experience working on Linux operating systems and cloud computing platforms such as Red Hat, Open Stack/Openshift and/or VMWare
•    Strong capabilities of data mining, machine learning and API design
•    Good understanding of computer technologies and architectures including TCP/IP, O/S, layer 2 and 3 networks, SNMP and MIB
•    Familiar with 4G and 5G core network technologies 
•    Demonstrated experience in building strong relationships with key stakeholders including senior management across the technology and partnering organizations
•    Comfortable with using MS Office Suite, preparing presentations for executives


Great-to-haves


•    Master’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
•    Professional certifications: Red Hat (RHCE), Openstack (COA), and Routing & Switching

item.title: Data Strategy Manager, Health & New Tech
item.description:
Description

Join our team


The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a mission to help TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions by delivering data analytics capabilities built on modern scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product culture. Our team members appreciate diversity of thinking, ideas and experiences, and are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.

The DSE team fulfills its mission by providing core services to the enterprise including advanced analytics & AI, data engineering and platform modernization along with data management enhancements to drive governance and quality improvements – all of these to drive exceptional customer experience and business performance outcomes for the organization.  With an elevated focus on data to drive our business, we are creating this new role to support strategic data-intensive initiatives in Health IT and new product areas. 

 

Your transformative role

You will work in a multi-faceted role – engaging in data science, data engineering and data governance contexts to develop the data strategy and data solutions in both TELUS Health and new product areas. You will apply TELUS wide policies and guidelines to ensure that there is overall convergence and alignment on data approaches to produce high quality, well-governed, effective data solutions and products.

 

Specifically, you will:

  • Work with business leads to understand the business strategy and formulate the requisite data strategy that supports and ensures product success.
  • Research the relevant domain knowledge and recommend what appropriate analytics and data architectures are warranted. 
  • Keep abreast of emerging technologies and standards. Recommend approaches to integrate classic decision-oriented architectures with more modern AI and machine learning -based approaches
  • Advise the product team on appropriate data resources and implement a resourcing game plan, as required. 
  • Establish the data management and governance framework to ensure data integrity is assured through its entire life cycle – from collection to transformation, to modeling and insights to retention and removal.
  • Participate in the analysis/evaluation of proposed specific use cases: economic, technology, return on investment, sensitivity etc…
  • Empower and help team members to resolve complex technical, process and business roadblocks.
     

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

  • Advanced degree preferred in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Health Informatics, Software Engineering or related field
  • AI Technology & Data Engineering Expertise: Deep technical knowledge and 3+ years’ experience in deploying AI and machine learning solutions, applying data science techniques to generate actionable insights and achieve economies of scale
  • Experience in healthcare or IT regulated industry experience (e.g. Telecom, Financial services)
  • Experience with data modeling, data engineering & big data ((processing and analyzing high volume, unstructured data on distributed platforms))
  • Operational Leadership: Extensive experience in engaging with stakeholders to understand business opportunities and leading cross-functional teams to deliver innovative cloud and applied platform technologies
  • Solid experience evaluating and implementing industry interoperability standards to simplify system integration efforts.
  • Business & Financial Acumen: Strategic investment expertise, with the ability to own the overall financial strategy around people, processes and technology, while ensuring strong delivery on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills
  • Significant experience working with agile software development methods, such as scrum and Kanban.
  • Prior experience establishing and maintaining data quality standards


Great-to-haves

  •   Experience implementing decision support systems is a plus

item.title: RF Design Specialist II
item.description:
Description

 

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.

 

Join our team

 

The wireless engineering team is a group of highly motivated and talented RF Engineers who have a passion for deploying the network infrastructure to achieve best in class network services to our customers. We are the team that engineer our 5G national RAN network.

 

The team is always at the cutting edge of wireless technology delivering the newest and the best services to our customers. With the advent of 5G, you will have the opportunity to work with peer RF Engineers to design the network while leveraging your automation, data science, and machine learning skills.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a Design Specialist II, you will collaborate with peer RF Engineers and provide technical support to ensure we efficiently deploy network infrastructure to meet the increasing customer demand for wireless services.

 

Your efforts will ensure that our millions of customers are able to enjoy a world class wireless network experience. Your creativity coupled with strong automation and big-data analytical skills will allow us to find the most efficient ways of building our wireless network to support existing mobility services and offer future new services.  We are searching for an engineer with extensive experience in both Macro RAN & Microwave RF design.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Using RF propagation modelling, you will develop novel techniques to simulate wireless coverage supporting the evolution of our networks (5G and IoT)
  • Collaborating with internal teams like Technology Strategy and Product Development to understand new technologies and services to prepare our team to succeed in an evolving business environment
  • Lead the implementation of wireless capacity augments, you will build working processes with performance and construction teams to drive improvements in customer experience
  • Developing dashboards and data visualizations you will provide insight into network performance that can be shared with executives, peer groups and tools that are implemented in customer portals 
  • Keeping up-to-date with software, data science, and RF technologies while proposing new ideas for platforms and tools

 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Bachelors degree in electrical engineering
  • Distinguished for your 5-years minimum experience in a RF engineering team (specifically with Macro RAN designs)
  • With a deep insight of industry standard propagation tools (ex. Planet, ATOLL) 
  • Respected for your knowledge of 3GPP (LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
  • Recognized for your strong understanding of databases and big data including MySQL, NoSQL databases, SPLUNK, Python and Alteryx
  • Valued for your effective communication skills while collaborating with both technical and non-technical team members
  • Commended for your inter-personal skills, critical thinking, analytical, and problem solving skills
  • Passionate about automation, data science, and machine learning

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Masters degree in Engineering or Computer Science
  • Knowledge of Tableau, Splunk or Alteryx
  • Experience with some of the following programming languages: C/C++, Java
  • Experience with SQL, database design and development (MySQL, SQL Server, PostgreSQL Oracle, Hadoop, MongoDB…)

Join our team

item.title: Design Splst II - Wireless Core
item.description:
Description

Make your mark on the leading edge of next-generation wireless networks and technologies!

 

Join our team

 

The Wireless Core Network Services DevOps team is at the forefront of driving strategy for the next generation of networks and technologies such as 5G, IoT, AI, and Virtualization. This team gets involved with the fundamentals of what the strategy is and how we can achieve it. Team Members are often considered innovators as they develop and enhance network designs aimed at improving client service reliability for core mobility services. The team incorporates passion and technical prowess to be highly effective in their risk mitigation and delivery. Often being met by difficult decisions, they remain invested in what they do and believe in what they are creating for the future.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a DevOps Engineer, you will drive strategy for 4G, 5G and the automation program for our core network infrastructure and services. Your creativity coupled with strong automation, data science, machine learning, and computer networking skills will allow us to find the most efficient ways of building and maintaining our wireless core network to support existing mobility infrastructure and offer new services.

You will exercise your entrepreneurial spirit and creative vision to change the way TELUS leverages technology. Collectively, the passion we have to transform the Network landscape will remain a leading factor in why customers continue to recognize TELUS as the fastest and most reliable network in Canada.

Description

Here’s how


•    Investigate and implement opportunities to leverage automation for the mobility core network and services
•    Implement machine learning algorithms and develop system APIs
•    Develop quality solutions through adherence to coding standards and test automation
•    Support the delivery of Technology and Automation specific programs
•    Participate in creation of technical design documentation: Detail design and architecture documents 
•    Participate in operational improvement initiatives, in conjunction with other technology teams in the company

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle


•    3+ years of relevant professional experience 
•    Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering
•    Familiar with Agile and CI/CD pipeline
•    Experience in the wireless core network, especially EPC (Evolved Packet Core – PGW, MME, DRA), IoT, NFV, SDN, 5G
•    Experience in network systems & process automation using DevOps tools and programming/scripting languages such as JavaScript, PowerShell, Python, Unix shell, Ansible, Jenkins, GitLAB
•    Experience working on Linux operating systems and cloud computing platforms such as Red Hat, Open Stack and/or VMWare
•    Strong capabilities of data mining, machine learning and API design
•    Good understanding of computer technologies and architectures including TCP/IP, O/S, layer 2 and 3 networks, SNMP and MIB
•    Familiar with 3G and 4G core network technologies (UMTS & LTE)
•    Demonstrated experience in building strong relationships with key stakeholders including senior management across the technology and partnering organizations


Great-to-haves


•    Master’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
•    Professional certifications: Red Hat (RHCE), Openstack (COA), and Routing & Switching

item.title: Sr Data Engineer
item.description:
Description

 

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data-driven solutions - doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data product-oriented culture. We are entrepreneurial and passionate believers that so much more is possible by leveraging data to create great value & outcomes for our customers, team members, communities.

You will work in a multi-faceted role – engaging in data science, data engineering and data governance contexts to develop data solutions in both TELUS Health and new product areas. 


Specifically, you\'ll apply your data talents to: 

  • Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and services that offers a best-in-class experience for data consumers 
  • Employ a data-as-a-product mindset, ensuring the usability, integrity and reliability of data including security, privacy and related data governance aspects.
  •  Implement the appropriate industry-wide health-related standards (e.g., HL7, FIHR, etc.) pertaining to the effective acquisition, integration, transformation, presentment and retention of  data.
  • Deploy automation and monitoring solutions to ensure quality and reliability service level objectives are met.

Qualifications

Skills & Experience

  • An expert understanding of data-oriented platforms, data warehouses/big data architectures & data integration /ETL processes
  • Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational and NoSQL databases and query authoring (SQL)
  • Experience with cloud platforms: GCP, Amazon or Azure (GCP preferred)
  •  Experience with multiple languages including Python & Java as well as software engineering best practices (e.g., Agile, CI/CD)
  • Advanced knowledge in developing solutions based on complex data types and leveraging big data technologies including Spark, Apache Beam, Flink, Dataflow, etc.
  • Experienced in test automation and data quality monitoring/Site Reliability Engineering
  •  Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Airflow, Prefect, Dagster, Ctrl-M, etc.
  •  6+ years of progressive and relevant work experience

 

You are known for

  • Having a proven track record in leading data analytics platform initiatives
  • Getting excited by the opportunity to build a team\'s capabilities to create value and innovate through data, and doing so in an agile manner with a bias for action and speed 
  • Envisioning and delivering future technical roadmaps while inspiring others along the way
  • Demonstrating resilience, a questioning mindset, and strong observation skills and curiosity – you never settle for the status quo!
  • Caring passionately about your stakeholders and providing them with the data and insights they need to deliver on their customer and business outcomes 

 

Great-to-haves

  • Post graduate education in Data Engineering, Cloud DevOps or Advanced Analytics
  • Machine learning and data science knowledge
  •  Cloud certification in data engineering and M/L

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Description

 

 

Ready to create innovative solutions and best practices?

 


Join our team


Have you ever dreamed about building an AI-driven technologically advanced platform capable of helping millions of people and changing their lives for the best? If so, your dream will come true with us


TELUS is looking for a passionate and talented Data Scientist to join a highly skilled and dynamic Advanced Analytics team. In this role, you will be a key contributor to our next generation Demand Forecasting, and Customer Behavioral & Customer Intents Prediction models. 

 


You will create the most advanced Machine Learning solutions to enable various stakeholders to better anticipate TELUS’ customers needs and help them meet customers’ inquiries in advance. 


Customer Experience AI, Data & Analytics Spotlight:


•    Our team works in a fun, innovative and challenging environment that directly influences the strategic direction and performance of the Customer Experience business
•    Our teams are responsible for the Demand Forecasting, Customer Intents and Behavioral Prediction, as well as Performance Analytics 
•    We work closely with our stakeholder teams to deliver on our strategic objectives; our key stakeholders and partners include Operations, Marketing, Finance, and Technology

 

Transformation and more


•    We provide opportunities for you to excel and show your stuff: work on high value and high visibility projects
•    We have flexible work styles with the ability to work in and out of the office 
•    You will work in a team that actively supports your personal development with progressive training and development tools


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together


As a Data Scientist, you’re in great company, working alongside some of the brightest and creative Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Data Analysts. You will be part of the journey that brings us to a better understanding of our customers, in order to predict their needs and interaction behaviour. 


With your expert knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, you will contribute to the development of state of the art ML & AI driven solutions such as demand forecasting, customer intents prediction and customer behaviour models.


Here\'s how

 

 

  •  Lead the development and implementation of ML & AI and Big Data solutions including predictive modelling, customer impact assessments, etc
  • Support and evolve the Advanced Analytics and Data Management roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technology
  • Execute, oversee, and evolve models and algorithms selection to deliver solutions that are relevant and facilitate decision making
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities
  • Identify opportunities for process/model optimization and refine to improve effectiveness/accuracy and enhance ROI  
  • Collaborate with Data Scientists and Data Engineers within TELUS as well as external Data Science communities

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

 

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning (Supervised and Unsupervised), Classification, Clustering, Segmentation, Time Series Analysis, NLP, Demand  Forecasting and Optimization, with 5 or more years of practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are capable of delivering technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras
  • You are comfortable with Jupyter environment and infrastructure, as well as know what GitHub, Spyder/PyCharm are
  • You possess advanced knowledge in SQL
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles
  • You are a collaborative, creative, open-minded individual who possesses a natural curiosity and desire to experiment with novel algorithms and technologies to perform hypothesis testing and validation, and develop ML-driven models through an iterative approach


Great-to-haves

 

  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science
  • Data visualization experience: Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, Domo
  • Data environments experience: MS SQL, Oracle
  • G-Suite experience
  • Experience with agile methodology and team-based software development workflows (e.g. JIRA)

item.title: Senior Data Engineers - Google Cloud
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team


We are looking for talented DevOps Google Cloud Data Engineers to join us and help drive our large-scale digital transformation program. This program is mandated with envisioning and building the future of digital life products for Canadians - from immersive entertainment to connected home experiences. Leveraging modern cloud-based solutions and a DevOps-forward mindset, you will be responsible for building and maintaining our big-data solution including real time data pipelines, databases, analytics assets and monitoring tools. You will work closely with Architects and Data Analysts to enable a robust architectural runway and accompanying analytics assets that support our needs to intelligently guide product evolution and manage benefits capture.  

 

We are the Future Friendly Home Services DevOps group, responsible for the end-to-end technology development and operations of TELUS’ Optik TV services, video and over-the-top services, broadband network capabilities, smart home solutions and software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) solutions. It’s an exciting time to be a part of our mission to drive better outcomes through customer-centric, state-of-the-art software platforms.


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

  • The goal: together we will create industry-leading end-to-end customer experiences for next-gen video and digital home solutions, incorporating superior performance, reliability and flexibility, by design.
  • You’ll contribute to an inclusive, knowledgeable and highly motivated team, using SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) practices to frequently deliver valuable software to market.
  • You’ll become a go-to expert on the data sets and underpinning big data and analytics solutions under your responsibility, how they fit into the overall architecture, and how they drive business value.
  • You’ll unlock the power of cloud services, having the freedom to leverage modern big data technologies to shape key products and services that define us as an organization.

 

Here\'s how

  • You’ll provide technical leadership and collaborate with senior architects and other DevOps professionals to design, build, and manage our big data and analytics solutions (pipeline, storage, analytics).
  • You’ll work closely with our Data Analysts to create analytics assets and integrate new data sources. 
  • You’ll use and develop modern cloud-based solutions and tools in GCP 
  • You’ll leverage DevOps values and your experience to address key operational considerations such as database and query performance, data quality, error handling, and operational monitoring. 
  • You’ll take responsibility for the components under your purview across the end to end lifecycle, implementing, testing, troubleshooting issues and supporting deployments. 
  • You’ll collaborate on agile PoCs to demonstrate advanced data science techniques such as predictive and machine learning driven analytics.  
  • You’ll integrate security into all daily efforts, including secure infrastructure practices.
  • You’ll estimate the effort needed to execute your end-to-end implementation tasks and support our technical leads in creating unified and reliable delivery plans.
  • You’ll effectively collaborate using SAFe agile practices to deliver value.

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle 
Don’t worry if you don’t yet meet every requirement below. We are looking for experienced individuals with a logical, curious and collaborative mindset and solid data solution engineering skills in a DevOps environment.

 

General:

  • At least 3 years (5+ years preferred) in a DevOps Data Engineer role with proven technical and analytical skills, as well as confidence in making and owning technical decisions.  This includes:
    • designing, building and operationalizing large-scale enterprise data solutions and applications using one or more of GCP data and analytics services in combination with 3rd parties - Spark, Cloud DataProc, Cloud Dataflow, Apache Beam, BigTable, Cloud BigQuery, Cloud PubSub, Cloud Functions, etc. 
    • designing and building production data pipelines from ingestion to consumption within a hybrid big data architecture, using Java, Python, Scala etc. 
    • architecting and implementing next generation data and analytics platforms on GCP cloud 
    • designing and implementing data engineering, ingestion and curation functions on GCP cloud using GCP native or custom programming 
  • Experience developing and using virtualization, container-based and cloud platforms such as Kubernetes, OpenShift, GCP, AWS, Azure etc. 
  • Experience in Python programming language.
  • Data storage design, build and management: SQL databases, data lakes, data warehouses. 
  • Data pipeline design, build and management: integration, ETL.
  • Data modeling and analysis: ad-hoc queries, report and dashboard design and build.
  • Data quality assurance.
  • Delivery experience using agile (ideally, SAFe) and DevOps best practices.
  • Experience building positive relationships and collaborating with a variety of diverse groups and technical teams.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • A creative approach to problem solving and the ability to work independently to manage deliverables in an environment with high levels of ambiguity.
  • Experience with incident management, problem management, operational excellence, within a 24x7 environment.
  • Bachelors in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering.

 

Key Technologies: 

  • Strong SQL/NoSQL skills with variety of RDBMS experience (Batch & Streaming data) – for source data analysis/extraction
  • Python with GCP APIs such as BigQuery, GCS, and Dataflow
  • PySpark, Scala and Java (nice to have)
  • Good understanding of ETL/ELT concepts 
  • Stack Knowledge, Big Query, Cloud Dataflow, Google DLP API
  • Apache nifi
  • Cloud Composer
  • git knowledge for source Code versioning 
  • Other tools and languages such as Tableau, PowerBI, Splunk, ELK, and Python or R for data analysis.

 

Nice to Have / “Further Learning Opportunities”

  • Join us to refine your existing skills and gain new ones in these areas:
  • Predictive analytics and machine learning
  • Experience with one or more Machine Learning framework(s) (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark ML, etc.)
  • Qlik Sense
  • Adobe Analytics
  • Data literacy and governance
  • Video Media or Digital Experience Platforms

FFHJOBS

item.title: Senior Product Manager (Data Science & Analytics)
item.description:
Description

 

 

As the Head of Data Science and Analytics, you will be responsible for leading a team of Data Science Practitioners in designing and implementing processes and layouts for complex, large-scale data sets used for modeling, data mining, and research purposes.

 

What you\'ll do in this role:

 

  • Design and build large and complex data sets, from spurious sources while thinking strategically about uses of data and how data use interacts with data design. Design and implement statistical data quality procedures for new data sources.
  • Communicate findings to business leaders in a way that can influence how an organization approaches a business challenge
  • Develop algorithms/software for accessing and handling data appropriately. Implement and hand off data checking and updating procedures to teams.
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that appropriately provides insights to the organization.
  • Train others on what data is available and how to use various sources
     

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle:

 

  • Previous Telecommunications data analysis experience is an asset; emphasis on location data and time series analytics
  • Master’s Degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Engineering or other quantitative field; With a solid foundation in modeling, statistics, analytics and math
  • Minimum of 5 years of hands-on data analytics experience in a corporate environment; Comfortable working with large, complex data sets from varying sources; Experience in team leadership.
  • Highly motivated with the ability to work on a multiple projects simultaneously;
  • Team player, creative, entrepreneurial, willing to experiment, persistent and structured.

 

You excel in the following:

 

  • Working with structured and unstructured data sets;
    • Leading analytics projects to support the strategic product direction, sales and customer efforts;
    • Performing hypothesis testing and develop predictive model;
    • Evaluating and providing input on potential business intelligence solutions.
    • Applying statistical principles to data analytics;
    • Comfortable in statistical analysis, clustering and data mining techniques to identify trends and insights
    • Developing end-end to models/ projects and automation in production environment.
  • Thorough understanding of relational database design;
  • High proficiency in SQL.
  • Fluent programming in Python, Hive, or SAS
  • Extensive experience in Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery, JupyterLab, docker container and workspace set up.
  • Knowledgeable about common supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning approaches (eg. feature engineering, classification, regression, clustering, NLP, time series forecasting, etc.  "Tensorflow”, “Deep Learning” and synthetic tabular data generation is a strong asset.

item.title: Senior Product Manager - TELUS Partner Hub COE - Affiliate & Ventures
item.description:
Description

 

The TELUS Business Solutions - Emerging Product Team is looking for a talented, driven, passionate individual with strong analytical, interpersonal, and collaboration skills. The ideal candidate will be inquisitive, curious and not afraid to try different approaches to solve a problem. Most critical will be the ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders across various marketing, finance, sales and operations. 


 
Your focus will be developing and overseeing enabling, scaling and evolving strategic partnerships in context of TELUS affiliates (M&A candidates or those that are acquired) and TELUS Ventures-back strategic partners in the space. The work here is aligned to business mandate of TBS Industry Solutions portfolio (next generation solutions anchored on 5G/IoT and data) and will work very closely with the internal and partner teams executing on the strategy to ensure a compelling benefits realization approach. The ideal candidate should have proven experience in technology and services industry with a focus on partner tactics, ecosystem enablement, and co-innovation models. 

 

What you’ll do in this role:

 

  • Role will be reporting directly to the Director of Emerging Tech Product due to the TELUS first/TELUS Business Solutions first framework impact of the assignment, role and outcome. 
  • Overall end-to-end enablement ownership of strategic partners (affiliate and ventures) with strong emphasis on managed services discipline and emerging technologies (anchored on 5G/IoT/Data and other new technology derivatives: business platforms, Industry 4.0 capabilities and others).
  • Manage planning, delivery and post-acquisition, post venture strategy development for targets of interest. 
  • Develop strategic, operational, financial and value stream enablement plans with program team and greater stakeholder group.
  • Develop competitive differentiation and benchmarking against TELUS\' competitors, as well as revenue acquisition, retention and amplification strategies. 
  • Develop forecasting revenues and units by product and customer segments aligned to target PLT owners. 
  • Develop, support execution of product/technology/services and operational roadmap for TELUS Partner Hub evolution
  • Develop, support execution of new product service introduction objectives 
  • Provide/lead internal & external processes innovation strategies to drive and improve customer experience for the TELUS Business Solutions
  • Provide product expertise to as well as lead national, cross-functional value chain team
  • Support development and implementation of industry-leading product & pricing strategies to maximize profit growth and retention
  • Support first year enablement of revenue and performance KPI before full on post-acquisition integration of before next round of TELUS Ventures funding
  • Optimize product profitability by establishing competitive price structures that capture value in the market, and meeting product and process rationalization and optimization targets
  • Manage the performance of Service Delivery for the Portfolio
  • Design scaling and transition strategy for affiliate and ventures pipeline for the greater TBS and TELUS organization.

 

       

      What you bring:

       

      • Experience in technology and services market research, focused on Partnership opportunity identification and Partner funnel development 
      • Experience building an ecosystem of strategic partners in support of new market development aligned to network effect (multi-sided networks).
      • Knowledge on sourcing and contracting partner, team agreements, contracting models and review process
      • Knowledge of contract strategy, pricing 101 and next generation multi-contract enablement
      • Service Integration & Management and integrated digital platforms and services strategy.
      • Affiliate management, ventures management from a concept and execution level. 
      • Technical background, possessing the ability to understand new market needs and identifying sound technology solutions / Partners that satisfy new market needs
      • Competitive understanding of core telco, 5G/IoT/data, value add services and next generation SaaS/ISV solutions
      • ISV ecosystem offerings in a sell to, sell with, sell through motion, and in context of co-innovation.
      • Project Management, Lean Methodology, Six Sigma and Process Efficiency Operationalization
      • Wireless / fixed broadband, Telecom and non-Telecom IT applications, systems, platforms and services
      • Engineering, IT or related technical degree with MBA preferred, or MBA with strong technical background and demonstrated experience/competence working with IP, wireless and related technologies, or 5+ years business background in a technology industry with relevant experience in a product management or development role.
      • Marketing, Business, Technical or Management certifications and/or professional designation (PMP, CSM, CPM, etc), will be an asset


       

      You’re the missing piece of the puzzle with:

       

      • Analytical and financial acumen skills; business analysis, analytics and process engineering
      • Knowledge of marketing principles and the relationships between pricing, share, value propositions, and demand drivers 
      • Superior research and presentation skills with the ability to present strategic options in a clear concise manner
      • Entrepreneurial spirit which will drive passionate ownership, process improvement and accountability for the product/portfolio 
      • Strong consulting, solution development competencies in various technologies, services and industries. Emphasis on 3rd wave and Industry 4.0 solutions.  
      • Business and enterprise architecture and design
      • Entrepreneurial mindset in the creation of solutions and translation to market products and services (business outcome/market sensitive)
      • Strong background on innovation and incubation tactics
      • Background in platform economy, data science and insights.  
      • Strong understanding and application experience in any of the following emerging technologies:
        • Digital platforms/ecosystems: Next generation OSS, BSS and Others
        • Platform economy, transaction and innovation platform business models
        • Multi-cloud/Hyperscalers
        • Blockchain
        • Automated Intelligence and Machine Learning
        • Data and Visual Insights
        • Micro-Services/API as a service 
        • Others: 5G, Secure Access Service Edge, Mobile Edge Computing, SD-WAN, cybersecurity and NFV and IoT
      • Proven leadership in business development for horizontal and vertical market needs.

item.title: Product Manager
item.description:
Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.

 

Join our team 

 

This is an exciting opportunity to take a leading role in transforming TELUS TV as the best customer experience and entertainment service in Canada. As Product Manager, Customer Journey Automation, you will be responsible for helping TELUS drive our ability to provide automated data driven, relevant, timely targeting and messaging to our customers in order to improve their experience and engagement with our TV product. You will collaborate cross-functionally with our marketing teams, technical teams and partner vendors in an agile manner as well as lead and coordinate various teams across the organization to launch products and services to market. 

You will be joining the Video Services Team in the Entertainment & Education Services group as part of Home Solutions Products & Services. This team bridges the business and technical worlds as we design, build and enable capabilities that provide great experiences for customers while achieving the best business outcomes for TELUS. We strive to be a leader in the market for innovation, clear and simple user experience, and content discovery. 

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

 

Product Management is about owning the product life cycle, end to end. Applying customer insights and data-driven approaches, you will develop the product backlog and roadmap, gather requirements and then design, build, test and launch features that will be used to improve the customer experience. You will continue to monitor and assess post-launch to make ongoing iterations so that we are developing products and services that truly resonate with users. You will work cross functionally to drive out use cases to improve the customer experience and you will enable others to leverage your product features in order to improve the customer experience. As Product Manager, you will bring together cross-functional teams with your vision, inspiration and organization, and offer thought leadership in strategic planning, assessments and overcoming of obstacles together. 

 

Here\'s how 

 

  • Develop strategic product roadmaps and solid business case justification for new products and enhancements based on user research, data and industry trends
  • Challenge the status quo and experiment with new approaches, tools, and techniques to improve our business’ bottom-line
  • Demonstrate tenacity and resilience that enables you to organize and spearhead initiatives, overcome challenges, and create solutions
  • Perform analysis on customer data and work cross functionally in order to understand and quantify opportunities
  • Manage the delivery of your roadmap 

 

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle 

 

  • Fluency in discussing and understanding technical concepts, scope/schedule tradeoffs, functional requirements and user experience design by collaborating with technical team members
  • The ability to lead, collaborate, support and influence cross functional teams
  • Ability to cultivate strong working relationships with a large extended project team and influence those around you
  • A passion for technology, entertainment and the digital home in general with inquisitiveness and curiosity to learn more
  • A fast learner who has a passion for exploring innovative ideas, and can drive changes through process improvements
  • Post-secondary education in Commerce/Business, Science, Engineering or Technology
  • Experience in any combination of product management, software development, data science and technical project management
  • A passion for data and machine learning 

 

Great-to-haves 

 

  • PMP, agile, lean certifications or relevant experience
  • Big data certifications or experience
  • Experience with customer journey analytics and toolsets, such as Adobe or Google analytics

item.title: Design Specialist II - RAN Development
item.description:
Description

Working with TELUS Technology Strategy teammates, stakeholders, and vendors, the successful candidate will be responsible for LTE and 5G RAN technology design and development, solution optimization, and provide technical support for Broadband Network P&E teams inside TELUS. The candidate must possess solid knowledge of LTE & 5G products, 3GPP specs, RF design and optimization and is willing to take challenges to deal with customer service impacting issues.
 
Responsibilities:
 
The successful candidate will join the Wireless Access Architecture Team within Technology Strategy by taking the following responsibilities: 
 
•    Responsible for LTE and 5G RAN network hardware, software and feature new technology introduction
•    Proactively Communicate/clarify TELUS requirements to vendors and evaluates responses
•    Translate LTE/5G technical aspects into business impact and vice versa, plus E2E integration requirement  
•    Propose solutions and features optimization engineering guidelines, provide support for field teams
•    Plan the execution of TELUS strategy and get involved in the execution 
•    Validate vendor compliance to industry/TELUS standards and the functional and performance requirements by conducting lab proof of concept and interoperability testing with other systems, etc.
•    Communicate and present cross-team to explain the technical decisions and their outcomes
•    Keep well informed of the latest wireless technology developments relating to the field of practice 

Qualifications

Required Knowledge:


•    Solid knowledge on LTE/5G RF design and optimization (5+ years’ experience), Proficient in RF propagation and modeling, interference and link budget analysis, and network infrastructure (Macro cell, Micro cell, Pico cell,) and protocols (i.e. TCP/IP).
•    Understand future network technology evolution: HeNet (small cell), AI & Machine learning, MEC, 5G Network slicing, and SDN/virtualization, Cloud technology …
•    Familiar with 3GPP spec., including air interface implementation, RRM, MM, and RF compliance.
•    Understand basic knowledge of IP, Video streaming, Multicast, and other networking protocols,
•    Hands-on experience with the network/performance testing tools such as IXIA, SmartBits, Chariot, QXDM, Agilent drive testing tool, XCAL, TEMS, and Actix tool IP based application knowledge and exposure to network security would also be assets 
•    5 or more years performing lab testing evaluations including and not limited to proof of concept. Experience in writing test plan for different scenarios, collecting requirements from users
•    Ability to provide on demand, specialized technical advice for the technical solution of a number of wide ranging problems and to interact with others including on a proactive customer focused basis
•    Familiar with wireless network trouble shooting procedure and performance enhancement process with knowledge related 


Required Skills and Abilities:


•    Excellent English oral and written communication skills
•    Proactive, can lead cross-team initiatives 
•    Strong team and collaborative skills, ability to lead/perform in a team environment
•    High level of personal energy and willingness to take the initiative in planning and organizing daily work
•    Sets high personal standards of performance and is capable of adapting to changes in priorities, work assignments and schedules in a dynamic environment
•    Good judgment in discerning between priority and non-priority issues
•    Sets and achieves challenging work goals for self (i.e. professionalism, self-motivated, ambitious, reliable, accurate, courteous)
•    Strong desire to acquire and apply new skills in a constantly evolving highly technical environment
•    Demonstrates strong sense of urgency and drives issues to closure
•    Proficient in the use and application of PC-based applications (i.e. MS Office suite: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio)

 

 Required Professional Designation/Certification:

•    Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering or an equivalent

 
 
Required Experience:

 

5+ years’ experience in wireless communication industry
